Issues.Title: vue compile / rendering does not work in child elements
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.14 ### Reproduction link [codepen.io](https://codepen.io/martinbe1io/pen/NWaQavq) ### Steps to reproduce I created a component "dynamic content" capable of displaying html (with vue variables/functions) generated from an api. the component utilizes vue.compile and render functions. it works great for the test case "slide working" in the app when I use my code for normal html tags. ``` testdata slide working
test {{this.getDynamic()}}
test {{this.getDynamic()}}
test {{this.getDynamic()}}
``` as soon es I try to use variables in cascaded components (see the sample "slide notworking", uses a test component named "test component") the compile function seems to ignore all the Childs. ``` testdataslidenotworking
test {{this.getDynamic()}}{{this.getDynamic()}}test {{this.getDynamic()}}test {{this.getDynamic()}}
``` ### What is expected? vue.compile should compile the child components as well ### What is actually happening? vue compile seems to stop at the first vue component
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "vue compile / rendering does not work in child elements" (#12438)

Issues.Title: Allow for bubbling of events in webcomponents
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Events emitted from webcomponents never reach their parent. This limits the use of webcomponents.

The CustomEvent API has a parameter for this, called bubbles. https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event/bubbles
 which fires the CustomEvent not just on the emitting webcomponent, but also on all its parents.

Currently, bubbles can not be set, only details are set: https://github.com/vuejs/core/blob/9c304bfe7942a20264235865b4bb5f6e53fdee0d/packages/runtime-dom/src/apiCustomElement.ts#L

### What does the proposed API look like?
The emit function could get an additional parameter, which would break things. Mainly, the emits function for webcomponents would be different than for normal components

Or bubbles could be defaulted to true, which would break other things. 

Emit can now receive an object with a name & callback. A property can be added to that object for options (there are more options than just bubbling: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Event )

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow for bubbling of events in webcomponents" (#12433)

Issues.Title: staticClass en el componente asincrónico empaquetado no representado en el servidor por vue-server-renderer
Issues.Body:
### Version 2.6.11 ### Reproduction link [codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/vue-issue-staticclass-on-wrapped-async-component-not-rendered-on-the-server-by-vue-server-renderer-nur3o?file=/_LOOK_HERE/test.html) ### Steps to reproduce Ignore todas las cosas de Nuxt.js en el repositorio. Necesitaba un Container CodeSandbox, así que comencé con una plantilla de Nuxt.js. Solo concéntrese en los archivos que menciono en los siguientes pasos. ¡El error no tiene nada que ver con Nuxt.js! ¡También ignore la salida del navegador de CodeSandbox! ¡Solo se trata del HTML en ./_LOOK_HERE/test.html! En el archivo ./_LOOK_HERE/test.html puede ver que
no tiene clase de prueba pero
sí. Ambos deben tener clase de prueba. En ./main.js puede ver los componentes AsyncDiv y SyncDiv. Son casi iguales, pero el primero es un componente de fábrica asíncrono. Los componentes WrapperAsync y WrapperSync son exactamente iguales pero representan los dos componentes respectivos. Esto es importante; si renderizo AsyncDiv directamente sin el contenedor, todo funciona como se esperaba. En la aplicación, representamos ambos envoltorios con la misma clase estática. En./render.js puede ver el código que produce ./_LOOK_HERE/test.html. Puede ejecutarlo en la terminal con node render.js, pero tiene un poco de errores en CodeSandbox si ha abierto test.html antes. Cierre la pestaña test.html antes de ejecutar el script. O simplemente créame que produce ./_LOOK_HERE/test.html. No en la reproducción: si el código procesado por el servidor está hidratado en el lado del cliente, la clase de prueba se agrega a AsyncDiv. Entonces parece que en el lado del cliente este caso se maneja correctamente. ### What is expected? In test.html both components should be rendered with the test-class. ### What is actually happening? nly the SyncDiv component correctly renders test-class. --- I would like to know if this new version has been updated, thank you very much
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "staticClass en el componente asincrónico empaquetado no representado en el servidor por vue-server-renderer" (#12432)

Issues.Title: build(deps-dev): bump shelljs from 0.8.3 to 0.8.5
Issues.Body:
Bumps [shelljs](https://github.com/shelljs/shelljs) from 0.8.3 to 0.8.5.
Release notes

Sourced from shelljs's releases.

v0.8.5

This was a small security fix for #1058.

v0.8.4

Small patch release to fix a circular dependency warning in node v14. See #973.

Changelog

Sourced from shelljs's changelog.

Change Log

Unreleased

Full Changelog

Closed issues:

  • find returns empty array even though directory has files #922
  • exec() should support node v10 (maxbuffer change) #915
  • grep exit status and extra newlines #900
  • Travis CI currently broken #893
  • Drop node v4 support #873
  • cp -Ru respects the -R but not the -u #808

Merged pull requests:

  • feat(options): initial support for long options #926 (nfischer)
  • test(touch): add coverage for -d option #925 (nfischer)
  • chore(node): add v10 and v11 to CI #921 (nfischer)
  • chore(test): no coverage by default #920 (nfischer)
  • fix(exec): consistent error message for maxBuffer #919 (nfischer)
  • chore(node): drop node v4 and v5 #917 (nfischer)
  • chore: script to bump supported node versions #913 (nfischer)
  • chore(npm): remove lockfile #911 (nfischer)
  • ci: change language to node_js and remove obsolete scripts #910 (DanielRuf)
  • chore: remove gitter integration #907 (nfischer)
  • fix: Exit 1 with empty string if no match #901 (wyardley)
  • feat(cp): support update flag when recursing #889 (joshi-sh)
Commits
  • 70668a4 0.8.5
  • d919d22 fix(exec): lockdown file permissions (#1060)
  • fcf1651 0.8.4
  • a1111ee Silence potentially upcoming circular dependency warning (#973)
  • See full diff in compare view

Issues.Title: Can not read props with array value inside watch
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.2.26

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
Open console and start change value of `model` at **App.vue**
You will see that even though the list that has been passed to **Comp.vue** show on the template, the value of list can not be read in the `watch` function ( only show `Proxy {}`, which is not a true value )

**What is more crazy is** that if you put `console.log(props)` right before or after `console.log(props.list)`, you will actually see that inside `props`, the list have the right data

### What is expected?
The value of `props` should be correct when read inside `watch` as it passed down

### What is actually happening?
value of list show correctly on template, but not in watch function

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can not read props with array value inside watch" (#12420)

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

HTML tags written using some uppercase letters (i.e. `<H1>` or `<Span>`) will stop rendering their children. This happens because those tags are considered components by the `maybeComponent()` function, so after applying these changes their children will be considered the contents of its default slot. As native HTML tags doesn't have slots, they won't be rendered. This is explained in more detail in the attached video.

The recommendation in this case is to write the standard HTML tags always in lowercase (in fact, in Vue 3 a "failed to resolve component" warning is displayed when an uppercase tag is used, even when it's still rendered).

Issues.Title: 子组件的根节点会被父组件的作用域样式影响【强烈建议取消这功能】
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
大部分时候组件都不想受到其它页面样式的影响。

组件的子节点好多时候是根据根节点的宽、高，颜色、背景颜色等等之类的布局的。
根节点一旦受到其它页面的样式影响，容易导致组件的子节点就开始发生错乱。

现在我为了定义不受其它页面的组件，不得不在根元素外面多添加一个没有必要的根节点。

而且想要调整该子组件布局，完全可以用props、style之类的达到目的。

### What does the proposed API look like?
https://codesandbox.io/s/youthful-bouman-9puy9?file=/src/components/Child.vue

如这里由于子组件样式受到父组件的影响。里面的文字已经看不清，一行的组件变成了两行。

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "子组件的根节点会被父组件的作用域样式影响【强烈建议取消这功能】" (#12412)

Issues.Title: Please add option eventType for watcher.
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
in my context i'm trying to build an auto-saving feature.
and I have a model named "Form" this model is an object which contains a lot of properties for ex: name, age, address, etc...

so when i first tried to make the auto-saving feature i first thought of using the watch(), since it does exactly what i wanted to do. 
then i tested it, noticed its firing the handler on every input event. which is something we dont want because it'd be a heavy request to the backend/api. so i figured if we just add an eventType parameter in the watch() then we can specify which event should we listen to before firing the handler.

### What does the proposed API look like?
``
watch() {
 form: {
   deep: true,
   eventType: 'change',
   handler: 'formChangeHandler'
 }
}
``

for the api version of watch() it'd be
``
this.$watch(
 'form',
 'change',
 () => {
})``

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Please add option eventType for watcher." (#12411)

Issues.Title: router-view is functional component which should not be used with keep-alive
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.5.3

### Reproduction link
[github.com](https://github.com/vuejs/core/issues/5207)







### Steps to reproduce
According to [keepAlive official doc](https://v3.vuejs.org/api/built-in-components.html#keep-alive)

> keep-alive does not work with functional components because they do not have instances to be cached.

However, according to [router-view doc](https://router.vuejs.org/api/#router-view), `RounterView` is a functional component.

this results in issue which can be reproduced in https://github.com/vuejs/core/issues/5207

### What is expected?
RounterView should work correctly with keep-alive

### What is actually happening?
RounterView  does not work correctly with keep-alive and two official documents are contradictive.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "router-view is functional component which should not be used with keep-alive" (#3701)

Issues.Title: docs: fix Korean language url path
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes the url path of Korean document from 'kr' to 'ko'.

All languages are using language codes in url path, except Korean.
The language code of Korean is 'ko', not 'kr'. (It's a country code)

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump handlebars from 4.7.6 to 4.7.7
Issues.Body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.7.6 to 4.7.7.
Changelog

Sourced from handlebars's changelog.

v4.7.7 - February 15th, 2021

  • fix weird error in integration tests - eb860c0
  • fix: check prototype property access in strict-mode (#1736) - b6d3de7
  • fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736) - f058970
  • refactor: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683) - 77825f8
  • chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13 - 3789a30

(POSSIBLY) BREAKING CHANGES:

  • the changes from version 4.6.0 now also apply in when using the compile-option "strict: true". Access to prototype properties is forbidden completely by default, specific properties or methods can be allowed via runtime-options. See #1633 for details. If you are using Handlebars as documented, you should not be accessing prototype properties from your template anyway, so the changes should not be a problem for you. Only the use of undocumented features can break your build.

That is why we only bump the patch version despite mentioning breaking changes.

Commits

  • 7d4d170 disable IE in Saucelabs tests

  • f058970 fix: escape property names in compat mode (#1736)
  • 77825f8 refator: In spec tests, use expectTemplate over equals and shouldThrow (#1683)
  • 3789a30 chore: start testing on Node.js 12 and 13

Issues.Title: build(deps): bump axios from 0.21.1 to 0.21.4
Issues.Body:
Bumps [axios](https://github.com/axios/axios) from 0.21.1 to 0.21.4.
Release notes

Sourced from axios's releases.

v0.21.4

0.21.4 (September 6, 2021)

Fixes and Functionality:

  • Fixing JSON transform when data is stringified. Providing backward compatibility and complying to the JSON RFC standard (#4020)

Huge thanks to everyone who contributed to this release via code (authors listed below) or via reviews and triaging on GitHub:

  • Guillaume Fortaine
  • Yusuke Kawasaki
  • Dmitriy Mozgovoy

v0.21.3

0.21.3 (September 4, 2021)

Fixes and Functionality:

  • Fixing response interceptor not being called when request interceptor is attached (#4013)

Huge thanks to everyone who contributed to this release via code (authors listed below) or via reviews and triaging on GitHub:

  • Julian Hollmann

v0.21.2

0.21.2 (September 4, 2021)

Fixes and Functionality:

  • Updating axios requests to be delayed by pre-emptive promise creation (#2702)
  • Adding "synchronous" and "runWhen" options to interceptors api (#2702)
  • Updating of transformResponse (#3377)
  • Adding ability to omit User-Agent header (#3703)
  • Adding multiple JSON improvements (#3688, #3763)
  • Fixing quadratic runtime and extra memory usage when setting a maxContentLength (#3738)
  • Adding parseInt to config.timeout (#3781)
  • Adding custom return type support to interceptor (#3783)
  • Adding security fix for ReDoS vulnerability (#3980)

Internal and Tests:

  • Updating build dev dependancies (#3401)
  • Fixing builds running on Travis CI (#3538)
  • Updating follow rediect version (#3694, #3771)
  • Updating karma sauce launcher to fix failing sauce tests (#3712, #3717)
  • Updating content-type header for application/json to not contain charset field, according do RFC 8259 (#2154)
  • Fixing tests by bumping karma-sauce-launcher version (#3813)
  • Changing testing process from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#3938)

Documentation:

  • Updating documentation around the use of AUTH_TOKEN with multiple domain endpoints (#3539)

... (truncated)

Issues.Title: getters result doesn't get cached
Issues.Body:
### Version
4.0.2

### Reproduction link
[codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/s/admiring-swartz-hcbh5?file=/src/main.js)







### Steps to reproduce
- Instanciate a Vuex store
- Call a getter multiple times without change in the parameters
- The getter gets called each time as the result isn't cached

### What is expected?
The getter function should be computed once only (as in this Vue 2 minimal reproduction: https://codesandbox.io/s/interesting-cerf-22fu3?file=/src/main.js)

### What is actually happening?
The getter function is called each time

---
Vue version: 3.2.26 (doesn't work on 3.1.5/3.0.11 neither)

Issues.Title: Can there be N popups(etc.), 1 page, and 1 store?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I'm developing an application in Vue3. What I need is to open and manage a particular component with window.open. I want my store(vuex) object to be the same on every page I open with window.open. E.g; Let my homepage have a value that says "Hello World" in an input and this is store->state->message:'Hello World'. I'm waiting for this post to appear on all windows I open. When I update this message on any page, I want it to update on all. Do we have such a talent?

### What does the proposed API look like?
https://github.com/frknclskn/manyPageOneStore/tree/main/src

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: If a new version of the application is deployed , the VueX is not reactive until user does a hard refresh
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.1.2

### Reproduction link
[sfc.vuejs.org/](https://sfc.vuejs.org/#)







### Steps to reproduce
Hi Team,

I am using the Vue 2 and the following VueX libraries,
"vuex": "^3.1.2",
"vuex-oidc": "^3.5.1",
"vuex-persistedstate": "^2.7.1"

My Issue:

this cannot be reproduced by code pen or sand box .

I am using a microfront-end, some of the modules developed by angular js and some of the modules are developed by vue js
user is working on application version-1, meanwhile the version-2 is deployed.
if user navigates to a page which is developed by Angular and if he comes back to the pages which is using vue js, I can see all the new changes but when I change the values in vuex.
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

### What is expected?
the state should be reactive

### What is actually happening?
The setter is working (vueX persisted store updating the localstorage) but getter is not (reactive) returning the new value.

---
if I do a refresh, it is working fine. but I wants to solve without a refresh.

is there anyway to solve the reactive issue of the VueX in this scenario?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
